title: News regarding RockMining
story_body:
RockMining Appoints New VP of Operations, Plans Industry Conference Participation

RockMining Corp. (NYSE: ROCK) announced today the appointment of Jennifer Martinez as Vice President of Operations, effective November 1. Martinez, who previously served as Senior Director of Mine Planning at the company, will oversee day-to-day operations across RockMining's North American facilities.

"Jennifer brings 15 years of mining industry experience to this role," said CEO Michael Chen in a statement. "Her technical expertise and leadership skills will be valuable as we continue to optimize our operational efficiency."

Martinez holds a degree in Mining Engineering from the Colorado School of Mines and has been with RockMining since 2019. She replaces Thomas Wright, who is transitioning to an advisory role after eight years with the company.

The company also confirmed its participation in the upcoming International Mining and Metals Conference in Toronto, scheduled for December 5-7. RockMining executives will host a booth in the exhibition hall and participate in two panel discussions focused on sustainable mining practices and automation technologies.

"The conference provides an important platform for engaging with industry peers and showcasing our recent technological improvements," said Chen. The company plans to highlight its automated hauling systems currently being tested at its Nevada operations.

In related news, RockMining launched a new digital marketing campaign titled "Mining for Tomorrow" aimed at improving public awareness of modern mining practices. The campaign includes educational content on the company's website and social media channels, featuring employee testimonials and virtual facility tours.

The company also announced a modest expansion of its community tree-planting initiative near its Arizona operations. The program, now in its third year, will plant an additional 5,000 trees in 2024, bringing the total to 15,000 trees planted since the program's inception. Local schools will participate in planting events scheduled for spring.

RockMining reported third-quarter revenues of $487 million last month, in line with analyst expectations. The company maintains its full-year production guidance of 1.2 million ounces of gold equivalent.

Shares of ROCK closed at $34.12 yesterday, up 0.3% on light trading volume.
